abstract: Dynegy said it would begin an alternative sales process after it became clear that Blackstone’s $5-a-share takeover offer did not have enough shareholder support.
snippet: Dynegy said it would begin an alternative sales process after it became clear that Blackstone’s $5-a-share takeover offer did not have enough shareholder support.
lead_paragraph: 7:09 p.m. | Updated  Dynegy said on Tuesday that it would seek new takeover bids after it failed to gain enough shareholder support for a proposed $4.7 billion deal to sell itself to the Blackstone Group.

headline.main: Ending Blackstone Talks, Dynegy Seeks New Buyer

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
